newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia Yield Spreads-Widen amid AIRC caution.
newsitem.headline: Australia Yield Spreads-Widen amid AIRC caution.

text.p: Australian bonds underperformed against the dollar bloc, giving up most of the spread narrowing seen last week as the market took a cautionary stance ahead of the first of this week's major events on Tuesday.
The Australian Industrial Relations Commission is finally due to hand down a verdict on the "living wage" claim.
If median A$12 per week expectations are met, this will be taken positively by the market as it will not put undue pressure on futures wages growth.
The second stage of key data will be on Wednesday when the March quarter CPI report is release, and again a benign outcome is forecast by economists.

"If we can keep our inflation below the U.S. and the U.S. starts to rise, I think that would be the bullish scenairo for bonds and spreads could actually narrow a bit further," said David Landsley, Treasury economist at National Australia Bank.
Forecasts centre on a 0.1 percent rise in headline CPI to year-on-year 1.2 percent and 0.4 percent growth on the underlying rate to 2.1 percent.

The Australian/U.S. 10-year bond yield spread dropped to around 90 basis points last week as the market corrected the advance to 120-130 basis points seen earlier this year and in anticipation of favourable wages and price outcomes.
